'''Beautifly''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''アゲハント''' ''Agehunt'') is a dual-type {{2t|Bug|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Silcoon}} starting at [[level]] 10. It is one of {{p|Wurmple}}'s final forms, the other being {{p|Dustox}}.

==Biology==
Beautifly is a butterfly-like Pokémon with two pairs of wings. It has large blue eyes and black antennae with rounded tips. Its face, underside, and four stubby limbs are gray, while the rest of its body is black. The main body of its wings is balck with large, yellow markings, and smaller red and blue markings. The upper pair of wings is larger and has a line of yellow along the top edge, while each of the lower wings have a long, round-tipped extension on the bottom. The female's wings have smaller red spots than the male. Beautifly has long and curled black proboscis that it uses to drain body fluids from its prey. Additionally, this aggressive Pokémon will jab at foes with its proboscis if it is disturbed while collecting pollen. Beautifly lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|forests}}.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:May Beautifly.png|thumb|250px|left|Beautifly in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[May's Beautifly]]=====
{{an|May}}'s {{p|Silcoon}} evolved into a Beautifly in ''[[AG028|Seeing is Believing]]''. From then on, Beautifly was used in many [[Pokémon Contest]]s during May's [[Hoenn]] {{pkmn|journey}}. In fact, Beautifly was called upon so often that [[May's Torchic]] began to feel jealous of it. Beautifly was eventually left at the [[Petalburg Gym]] after May competed in the [[Hoenn Grand Festival]]. It briefly rejoined May's [[Party|team]] in ''[[AG187|The Unbeatable Lightness of Seeing!]]'', and again to participate in the [[Wallace Cup]] during the {{series|Diamond & Pearl}}.

=====[[Aaron's Beautifly]]=====
{{EF|Aaron}}'s {{p|Wurmple}} was revealed to have evolved into Beautifly in ''[[DP099|A Trainer and Child Reunion!]]''.

=====Other=====
In ''[[AG013|All Things Bright and Beautifly!]]'', [[Janet]] used her Beautifly in the [[Rustboro City]] [[Pokémon Contest]]. It was able to advance to the [[Contest Battle|Battle Stage]] and reach the final round, where it went up against {{an|Chaz}}'s {{p|Venomoth}}. It managed to win the battle, earning Janet the Rustboro [[Ribbon]]. This Beautifly inspired {{an|May}} to become a {{pkmn|Coordinator}} and to {{pkmn2|caught|catch}} her own {{p|Wurmple}}.

[[Sakura]] has a Beautifly, which she used to help {{an|Misty}} stop [[Gym Badge thieves|the thieves]] in ''[[SS005|The Blue Badge of Courage]]''.

A Beautifly appeared in ''[[M12|Arceus and the Jewel of Life]]'', under the ownership of [[Kiko]]. It was used in a [[Multi Battle|Tag Battle]] against [[Ash's Pikachu]] and [[Dawn's Piplup]] alongside [[Kato]]'s {{p|Heracross}}.

====Minor appearances====
Beautifly debuted in ''[[AG001|Get the Show on the Road!]]''.

A flock of Beautifly appeared in ''[[AG011|A Bite to Remember]]''.

Two Beautifly appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]''.

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Beautifly appeared in ''[[DP011|Mounting a Coordinator Assault!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Appeal|Performance Stage]] of the {{ci|Jubilife}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

Multiple Beautifly appeared in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]'' and ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

A group of Beautifly appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'', at [[Pokémon Hills]].

==Trivia==
* Beautifly shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Butterfree}}. They are both known as the Butterfly Pokémon.

===Origin===
Beautifly appears to be based on the {{wp|swallowtail butterfly}} while its {{Shiny}} coloration may be based on the {{wp|eastern tiger swallowtail}}'s.

====Name origin====
Beautifly is a combination of ''beauty'' and ''butterfly''. It may also be a play on ''beautify''.

Agehunt may be a combination of 揚羽蝶 ''agehachō'' (swallowtail butterfly) and ''hunt''.
